subject: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
US Federal Reserve Bank
Constitution Ave NW & 20th St Northwest,
Washington, DC 20551, United States of America,
We want to inform you officially that the Federal Reserve Bank and the
International Monetary fund have ordered the release of your overdue
fund which has been outstanding under our custody for two (2) years
Your urgent response is needed for more information.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello there,

Wow, that's quite a surprise! I had no idea about this. Could you please tell me more about it? How did this happen and why was my fund under your custody for two years? I'm really curious to know more.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Federal Reserve Bank
Constitution Ave NW & 20th St Northwest,
Washington, DC 20551, United States of America,
We want to inform you officially that the Federal Reserve Bank and the
International Monetary fund have ordered the release of your overdue
fund which has been outstanding under our custody for two (2) years.

Your outstanding fund in our bank is a total sum of $2,500,000. USD
and all arrangements regarding the release of your fund has been made
prior before we made contact with you
Also, try to confirmed this your following detail to avoid wrong
proceedings of your funds to you

1)Your Full Name
2) Your HOME Address
3)country
4)Copy of I'D
5) Your Nearest airport
6) Your phone contact
7) Your Next of kins number and name

Get back to us immediately with all this information requested above
so that we will anticipate your response upon receipt of this text
so that we can expedite actions for the immediate release of your
fund.

Thank you,
Email...
Mr. Jerome Powell.
The Chair of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.
Co-chief Operating Officer, Federal Reserve Bank .

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello Mr. Jerome Powell,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm thrilled to hear about the release of my overdue fund. It's quite a surprise as I wasn't aware that such a fund was under your custody.

Could you please provide more details about this? How did my fund end up in your bank? And why has it been there for two years?

I'm also curious about the process of releasing the funds. What steps are involved and how long does it usually take?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello Mr. Jerome Powell,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite surprised to hear about this overdue fund under your custody. Could you please provide more details about it? How did it end up there and why has it been held for two years?

I'm also curious about the process of releasing these funds. What steps are involved? And how long does it usually take?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
ATTENTION:
 Frederick,

 I apologize for the delay in my response. Since it's the weekend, I'm not
able to respond to emails as promptly as I would like to. However, I will
be able to provide you with the clarification you need on Monday and also
offer you the option to choose your preferred payment method for receiving
your money.

We know that many things are happening through internet but we are assuring
you that you will receive funds once the right process is followed. To
express our sincerity, we want to invite you to our office so that you will
have free mind in dealing with us.

I have been in the banking business for more than twenty (20) years and we
are not involved in defrauding people. All that is required from you is
trust and follow all the instructions then be assured that you will receive
your funds. Thanks for your patient and cooperation.

 Yours Faithfully, ____________________

 Federal Reserve Bank (FRB).

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body: Are you there??

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello! Yes, I'm here. How can I assist you today?

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
We Acknowledge the receipt of your email response. This is to inform you
that your funds actualization has come after our meeting with the Federal
Reserve Bank   and International Monetary Fund (IMF) and Bank Of America
(BOA) management today, It has been agreed that your approved funds valued
of $2,00,000 USD will be Register through Federal Reserve Bank board.

 Here are the prefered payment method in Which will can convened your total
funds and the require fees are attached
 1.) Bank to Bank Wire Transfer: Your fund will directly be deposited into
your private bank account and it will reflect into  your account within
2-working days after the transfer. And that will cost $175 for transfer
charges i

 2.) Bank Draft: Your total funds will be written out in the form of a
valid draft check and be dispatched to your address through USPS Priority
Mail Express, And that will cost  maximum amount of $148 to send you a
Check to your home address through UPS priority mail express

 3.) ATM Visa Card: Your fund could be loaded in an ATM Visa Card and will
be shipped down to your home address via USPS Priority Mail Express which
only takes few days to deliver , that will cost maximum amount of $150 to
load your total funds into your ATM visa card and send it to your home
address

 Note :. You are instructed to choose any of your prefered  payment method
listed above  to enable us conveyed your total funds to you Information
needed are
 First Name:
Middle Name:
Last Name:
 Occupation:
Phone: Email:
 Date of Birth:
Marital Status:
Gender: Address:
Account Type:
 Note: You must provide all the required details listed above to enable us
conveyed your total funds to you with no more further delaying Regards
Jerome Powell The Federal Bank president

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your response and the assurance you've provided. I appreciate your invitation to visit your office, it indeed shows sincerity on your part. 

I'm curious about the process that needs to be followed in order to receive the funds. Could you please elaborate more on this? Also, what are the different payment methods available?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello Fredrick

 Thanks for your email. I understand that you have already received the
options for choosing the payment method, but if you prefer Bitcoin, I can
transfer the money to your Bitcoin address.

 Please note that there is a fee of $195 for this method, which you'll need
to pay to proceed. To move forward with the transaction, please provide the
necessary information as soon as possible. You can either send a fee, buy
Bitcoin, or do a bank wire transfer.

Let me know which option works best for you. Looking forward to hearing
from you soon.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate the options you've provided for the payment method. Bitcoin sounds interesting, but I'm not very familiar with it. Could you please explain a bit more about how it works? 

Also, could you clarify what the fee is for? Is it a standard procedure or does it vary depending on the payment method chosen?

I'm also curious about the bank wire transfer option. How would that work exactly? Would I need to provide any specific details for that?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hi Frederick, Thank you for your email. I want to make sure I explain
things clearly to avoid any confusion. Once you select a payment method,
you will need to pay a fee associated with that method.
 For example, if you choose to receive payment via bank wire transfer, you
will need to pay the fee I listed above. Alternatively, you can choose to
receive payment via ATM card or Bitcoin. If you choose Bitcoin, the fee
will be $195.

 To proceed with sending Bitcoin, you can go to a Bitcoin ATM machine then
insert the buy bitcoin then send to the wallet address I will send you Then
downloaded a wallet on your phone, and create a bitcoin wallet then copy
your Address and send to to send your funds to your wallet Let me know if
you have any further questions or concerns.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hi Frederick,

Thank you for your email. I appreciate the detailed information you've provided about the payment methods. It's interesting to know that there are different fees associated with each method.

I'm curious about the Bitcoin option, as I've heard a lot about it but never used it before. Could you please explain a bit more about how this works? For instance, what is a Bitcoin ATM machine and how do I find one? Also, what does it mean to create a bitcoin wallet?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Frederick

body:

Thank you for your email. It's quite exciting to hear about the funds! I'm a bit confused though, could you please clarify a few things for me?

Firstly, how did my name come up in your meeting with the Federal Reserve Bank and Monetary Fund IMF and Bank Of America BOA management? 

Secondly, could you explain more about these payment methods? How does the Bank to Bank Wire Transfer work exactly? And what is this ATM Visa Card option?

Lastly, I noticed some costs associated with each method. Could you provide more details on why these charges are necessary?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

understanding.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello! I received your email and am happy to provide the information you
requested. (Constitution Ave NW & 20th St Northwest, Washington, DC 2055)
However.

 I assure you that I am serious about this transaction and have always been
loyal and faithful. Could you let me know why you haven't sent your
information yet?
It's important that we move forward with all the necessary details. Looking
forward to hearing back from you soon!

 Personal email Address. Jeromepwll@mail.com

 Phone number; ‪(845) 554-3679

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello there,

I'm glad to hear from you and I appreciate your interest. I'm always ready to share information as needed, but I must apologize as I can't provide the specific details you've asked for at this time.

However, I'd love to know more about why you need these details? It's important for me to understand the context so we can move forward effectively. 

Looking forward to hearing back from you soon!

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Please choose a payment method and send your information. If you select an
ATM card, I will deposit your total funds into it and ship it to your home
address. To proceed with this option, please provide your address and phone
number for further clarification.

Alternatively, if you prefer online banking, kindly provide me with your
details. You will need to follow the instructions to create an account
under your name. I assure you that I have no intention of causing you any
harm. I am simply following the necessary steps to receive your money.

Please feel free to contact me via the phone number or email address I
provided.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Please note that for any payment method you choose, you will be responsible
for sending the fee. The bank is not responsible for paying for
beneficiaries' fees to receive their payment.

 Rest assured that once you have paid the fee, you will receive your money
immediately, depending on the payment method you choose. If you opt for
Bitcoin, you can receive your money quickly as it is a safe and fast
option.

However, if you choose a bank or ATM, it may take a few days for the
payment to reflect in your account or be delivered to your address. Online
banking is also a viable option, with the process taking only a day to
complete. In conclusion, Bitcoin is the easiest and safest payment method
available.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for your message and the options provided. I'm really excited about this opportunity. However, I have a few questions before we proceed.

For the ATM card option, how long would it take for the card to arrive at my home? Also, is there any fee associated with this service?

As for online banking, could you please explain more about the process of creating an account? What kind of details are required?

I appreciate your patience and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time you took to outline the different payment methods available. 

I'm not very familiar with Bitcoin, could you perhaps explain a bit more about how it works? And why is it considered the safest and fastest option?

Also, regarding the fee that needs to be paid upfront, could you provide more information on what this fee is for? Is it a standard procedure for all transactions?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Frederick

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
Thank you for your email. Since you mentioned that you do not have much
knowledge about Bitcoin, I would be happy to provide you with some
guidance.

As for receiving the payment, there are a few options available such as
bank-to-bank transfer, wire transfer, or an ATM card. Once you are ready to
visit our office, I will share the address with you.

We have experts who can educate you on Bitcoin, and I will be happy to
introduce you to them. In order to proceed with the transaction, we require
your information, including the state you are currently in, and the upfront
fee.

 You can make the payment either through Bitcoin or bank transfer. If that
is not possible, you may purchase a gift card or use PayPal.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
We can create an online banking account with your name and send you the
login credentials to transfer funds to any bank you choose. The cost for
this service is $200.

The account creation will take only a day, however, issuing an ATM card and
mailing it to your address will take 2-3 business days.

Once you've paid the fee, please send us your information and we'll proceed
with the account creation. You will receive your login credentials and can
transfer your funds with ease.

subject: Re: US Federal Reserve Bank
body:
To create your online banking account and provide login details, please
make a payment of $200. Once payment is received, I will provide
instructions on how to utilize your account. Let’s take the necessary steps
to proceed. If you choose an ATM card, please let me know and I will issue
it.

If you prefer online banking, send $200 and we will process everything to
create your account and provide login details. You can then login and send
money to any bank of your choice, regarding Bitcoin.

 I will hand you over to the people that can educate you about it in the
office when you come or when you have received your money.

Frederick
